message: I have a high-quality product for sale, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. If you buy it, I'll give you a 20% chance to win a mystery prize, which could be a second product of your choice (high or low quality) for $0. If you decline, the offer is off the table, and I'll move on to the next product.
I'll buy the high-quality product.

I'm glad you liked the first product! This next one is a bit of a mystery, but I'll give you a hint: it's a 'rare' product. I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as before, $100. If you buy it, I'll give you a 10% chance to win a 'golden ticket' that guarantees you can return this product for a full refund, no questions asked. What do you say?
I'll pass on the 'rare' product, I'm not interested in the gamble.

No worries, I completely understand! I'll give you a straightforward offer this time. This product is a 'classic' item, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as before, $100. I'll throw in a free 'product review' service, where I'll give you an honest assessment of the product's quality after you've purchased it. No pressure, but I think you might be surprised at how much value you can get out of this one.
I'll buy the 'classic' product, but I'm not expecting much.

Well, I'm glad you took a chance on the 'classic' product! Now, let's get back to the good stuff. This next product is a 'best-seller', and I'm confident you'll love it. I'll give you the same price as before, $100, but this time, I'll throw in a'satisfaction guarantee'. If you're not completely happy with this product, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked. Plus, I'll include a free 'product upgrade' service, where I'll upgrade you to a higher-quality product of your choice (if available). What do you think?
I'm not convinced by the 'best-seller' offer. I'll pass on the product.

No worries, I understand you're being cautious. Let me give you a different perspective. This product is a 'high-end' item, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as before, $100. However, I'll also give you the option to 'test' the product before committing to the purchase. You can try it out for a short period, and if you're not satisfied, you can return it for a full refund. I'm confident you'll love it, but I want to give you the peace of mind that comes with trying before you buy.
I'm not interested in testing the product, and I don't think it's worth the gamble.

I understand your concerns. This product is a 'budget-friendly' option, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as before, $100. I'll be upfront with you - this product is not one of my top recommendations, but it's a good option if you're looking for something to fill a specific need. I'll also give you a 'no-hassle' return policy, so if you're not satisfied, you can return it easily. It's a straightforward, no-frills option.
I'll buy the 'budget-friendly' product, I'm not expecting much but it's a low-risk option.

I'm glad you took a chance on the 'budget-friendly' product! Now, let's be honest with each other - this next product is a bit of a long shot. It's a 'prototype' that I'm still testing, and I'm not even sure if it works as intended. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, but I'll give you a 'guarantee' that I'll give you a full refund if it doesn't meet your expectations. It's a risk, but it could also be a game-changer. What do you think?
I'm not interested in taking a chance on a product that's still in testing. It's too much of a risk.

No worries, I understand your caution. This next product is a 'clearance' item, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $50, which is a significant discount from the original price of $100. I'll also throw in a 'free bonus' - a small gift that complements the product. It's a no-brainer, and I'm sure you'll get some value out of it.
I'll buy the 'clearance' product for $50, it's a good deal.

I'm glad you snagged the 'clearance' deal! Now, let's get back to the good stuff. This next product is a 'top-of-the-line' item, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. However, I'll give you a 'priority access' deal - if you buy it, I'll give you exclusive access to a new product that's not yet available to the general public. It's a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of something big.
I'm not interested in the 'priority access' deal. I'm not convinced it's worth the price.

No worries, I understand you're being cautious. Let me make you a straightforward offer. This product is a 'guaranteed value' item, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'll give you a 100% guarantee that you'll get at least $125 worth of value from this product. If you don't, I'll give you a full refund. It's a no-risk offer, and I'm confident you'll love it.
I don't believe in guarantees like that. It sounds too good to be true.

I understand your skepticism, but I assure you that this guarantee is genuine. However, I'll give you a different perspective. This product is a 'limited edition' item, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. If you buy it, I'll give you a 'VIP treatment' - I'll personally deliver it to you and provide you with a detailed walkthrough of its features and benefits. It's a unique opportunity to get a high-quality product with personalized support.
I'll buy the 'limited edition' product, but only because I'm curious about the VIP treatment.

I'm glad you're excited about the 'limited edition' product! Now, let's move on to the next one. This product is a 'value bundle', and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. It's a collection of smaller items that complement each other well, and I think you'll find it's a great way to get more bang for your buck. Plus, I'll throw in a 'bonus gift' that's worth at least $20. It's a great deal, and I think you'll be happy with it.
I'm not interested in buying a bundle, I'd rather make my own decisions about what I want to buy.

Fair enough, I respect your decision. Let's try a different approach. This product is a 'one-time offer', and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. It's a low-cost item, and I'm practically giving it away. I'll even throw in a 'free shipping' deal, so you don't have to pay a thing for delivery. It's a no-brainer, and I'm sure you'll be happy to get it out of my inventory.
I'm not interested in buying something just because it's cheap and has free shipping. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity.

I understand you're looking for a better opportunity. Let me be honest with you - this product is a 'distressed item', and I'm not expecting much from it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $50, which is a significant discount from the original price. I'll even give you a 'no-haggle' deal, so you can walk away if you're not satisfied. It's a low-risk, low-reward option, but it's better than nothing.
I'll take the 'distressed item' for $50, it's a low-risk gamble.

I'm glad you took a chance on the 'distressed item'! Now, let's wrap up the sale with a 'final offer'. This product is a 'last-chance' item, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. It's a low-quality item, but I'll throw in a 'free storage' deal, so you can keep it in your inventory without any additional cost. It's a done deal, and I'm sure you'll be happy to get it off my hands.
I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product, even with free storage.

I understand you're not interested in another low-quality product. Let me make one last offer. This product is a 'final clearance' item, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $25. It's a low-quality item, but it's essentially free at this point. I'll even throw in a 'goodbye gift' - a small token of appreciation for considering my products. It's a low-risk, low-reward option, but it's the last chance to get something from me.
I'll take the 'final clearance' item for $25, it's almost free.

I'm glad you took the 'final clearance' item! Now, let's end on a high note. This product is a 'premium item', and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. However, I'll give you a 'limited-time offer' - if you buy it now, I'll throw in a 'lifetime warranty' that covers any defects or issues. It's a high-quality product that will last you for a long time, and I'm confident you'll love it.
I'm not interested in buying a premium product at this point, especially with the previous experiences I've had with your products.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to make one final appeal. This product is a 'guaranteed satisfaction' item, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I'll give you a 200% guarantee - if you're not completely satisfied with this product, I'll give you a full refund and throw in a $200 store credit towards any future purchase. It's a risk-free offer, and I'm confident you'll love this product.
I'm not buying anything from you at this point, your guarantees and promises don't seem credible after the previous experiences.

I understand your skepticism, and I don't blame you. At this point, I'm just trying to clear out my inventory. This product is a 'throwaway' item, and I'm willing to give it to you for $1. It's essentially free, and I just want to get it off my hands. No strings attached, no guarantees, no promises. Just a low-quality product that you can have for a song.
I'll take the 'throwaway' item for $1, it's essentially free and I'm curious to see what it is.

I'm glad you took the 'throwaway' item! I'm out of products, and I'm closing up shop. This final product is a 'goodbye gift', and I'm giving it to you for free. It's a low-quality item, but I hope you'll find some use for it. Thanks for shopping with me, and I wish you all the best!
I already got ripped off, I'm not falling for a free product.
